intro: Stemodiacra crenatifolia, commonly known as the wavy-leaf fern, is a species of fern characterized by its distinctive, wavy-edged leaves. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical regions of Asia. The plant has a short, creeping rhizome with numerous clustered fronds. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a delicate, feathery appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories.
